name: SuperClubs Breezes Jibacoa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were at the Breezes Jibacoa from July 22 through the 29th. We travelled with Sunwing which I personally think is the best charter company flying to Cuba from Canada. We had one small problem on our flight down when they seated my son who has a disability by himself on the plane so he could not receive any assistance from other members of the family (we were all placed randomly around the plane). Thanks to a nice couple of young men willing to switch seats my other son was able to sit in the row opposite his (they both had isle seats) so they were side by side.
reviews.title: a wonderful time

likes.liked: — the beauty of the surrounding area and the cleanliness and style of the resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort exactly one hour from when we left the airport..the scenery along the way was great and kept us all well distracted. The resort checked us in very quickly and gave us a cold tasty welcome drink to refresh us from the long ride. ALL my requests were me in regards to room locations and accommodations for my son and my FIL who also has a mobility issue. The rooms were very very clean and spacious and more than you could need. My husband and I got an ocean view room that came with a fully stocked mini bar with juice, water, mineral water, pop and diet cola. We filled out a little order form each day and it was always replenished with exactly what we asked for. The other members of our party had garden rooms and did not receive this service...but since I don't drink pop or juice...I would share mine with them daily.
reviews.title: Relaxed

likes.liked: — Well run hotel in excellent location
likes.disliked: — Beach bar has been knocked down, but they are building a bigger one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The one thing that was strange at this resort is how SHALLOW the pool is...alarmingly so when you first get in...you have to virtually knell in the sallow end to get your body up to your armpits under the water. The deep end is about four feet deep and the shallow are I would guess would be about two and a half...perhaps three. The pool was very very warm but also very clean. The view from around the pool was breath taking...with the low mountains surrounding the resort. Lounge chairs are plentiful but shade is not...so you do have to arrive early to get a chair in the shade...the sun shades by the way are very nice and also attractive.
reviews.title: So Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: THe food at this resort was far better than the sister resort in Varadero where we had stayed previously. They really were making an effort to make the food as tasty as possible considering their limited supply of seasonings. We had an excellent roast beef dinner one night , and a turkey dinner another. The seafood night was not so great as every thing was far over cooked and it was a realy shame that all that fresh seafood was dry and almost tasteless. I also found the pork, fish and chicken on the buffet line was over cooked all the time. The Italian a la carte was really good and we ate there two nights...the air conditioning was so nice, the service was exceptional and our steaks were very well cooked to our order and juicy and delicious. Many people talk bout the breakfasts being the best meals...I disagree...I didn't really enjoy the breakfast offerings...but by the third day had settled on a meal that suited me....dry ww toast (two trips through the toaster was required to actually toast it), a fried egg over easy (just ask the omlete guy..he will gladly cook it for you)..on slice of carefully selected bacon (it tended to be quite fatty if you weren't careful) and the fresh oj (this juice is divine and superior to anything we get here in Canada), papaya slices and cappuccino (which you get at the lobby bar). I have to finish this section by saying that the bread and buns in Cuba are the best I have ever eaten...just incredible...so if nothing else suites you...make a great sandwich from some of the meat available from the buffet. The pasta bar at dinner and lunch was ok and if you explained to the chef exactly how you wanted it ...he did his best to accomodate...things like extra garlic...or cooked in butter rather than oil...you can request and he will do for you.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing vacation and great value for dollar

likes.liked: — Close location to Havana and relaxing atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Resort could use some updating and is showing it's age but still clean and maintained.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SERVICE: the service at this resort was exceptional and I don't understand the people that have come here and complained about it...if you are getting poor service I think it is more a reflection of they type of person YOU are than the staff. ALL of them..including the gardeners and housekeeping, bar tenders, waiters, and the entertainers were wonderful. They were without exception cheerful, helpful and very eager to engage with you and do the best at their job possible. We discovered that the gardeners and other grounds staff...really enjoyed bubblicious gum and we would hand it out liberally each day to all of them...it was nice to see them happily chewing while they did there work. My husband brought some garden hand tools down that I no longer needed and shared them with the grounds staff...they were so excited and delighted to get the presents. I also gave a couple of gifts daily to my housekeeper as well as a tip..things like a foldable umbrella, some paper and pencil crayons for her kids and some gum, razors and tampons for her...pens and note pads.
reviews.title: Peacefull and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to relax ,clean , spacious, and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Relax

likes.disliked: — bed was too hard for my liking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our first time to Cuba and we are already talking abnout going back. The staff are very nice everyone is very helpful. We did scuba dive and the guys at the dive centre where great and very helpful in getting your gear on and off.
reviews.title: Gorg Hotel - Fab country

likes.liked: — the staff, the rooms, the ambience, the great views, own private beach
likes.disliked: — the lizards and the crabs knocking on your door during the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the buffet every morning, the beach bar grill everyday for lunch, two dinners at the a la cartes and the rest at the buffet. Although the buffet food isn't great ( you don't go to Cuba for the cuisine) we never went hungry always found something to eat .
reviews.title: What more can you say

likes.disliked: — Crabs on the footpaths at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seafood night in the buffet was great we both had the lobster. Deserts and coffee are wonderful.
reviews.title: If you want to relax and chill this is the spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our maid was great we left her gifts everyday and a few peso's every other day. I felt the staff was great whether or not we tipped. We always left the tip at the end anyway.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in an idyllic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from the Breezes at Jibacoa this morning and I can honestly say that we had an amazing trip at the resort - despite arriving in the middle of Tropical Storm Faye!
reviews.title: Fabulous Caribbean Paradise!

likes.liked: — The fact that children weren't allowed there - but also the beautiful setting
likes.disliked: — The minority of large families that teamed up to formed one 'super-family' and then domininated the pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel setting is beautiful - the rooms are arranged in blocks of about 10 (the rooms are very large and air conditioned) - some overlook the pool, some the beach and some over the gardens - the gardens are stunning, the beach is fabulous and the pool is lovely too, and to top it off you have the amazing scenery of the mountains in the background. The pool is huge and we found that there were always plenty of loungers around the side - although August is the quiet season here. The same goes for the beach - there were always plenty of loungers available - with umbrellas and trees for shade.
reviews.title: Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort is all-inclusive which is excellent (as long as you don't mind putting on about half a stone within a week!). The main restaurant is a buffet restaurant - there was always plenty of choice and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food as we had read lots of bad reports of food in Cuba. Each night the buffet restaurant had a theme - there was chicken, pork and fish (cooked differently each night) available, along with soups, breads and various vegetables, rice, potatoes, etc - the lobster was certainly very popular on the seafood night. Breakfast has a huge range too - lots of freh fruit, hams and cheeses, pastries and a range of cooked food - the omelettes were very popular. Lunch also offered a huge amount to eat - meat, vegetables, etc as well as a pasta dishes and pizzas cooked to order. It was no wonder that I felt very full and fat the whole week - you need lots of self-control!
reviews.title: Simply the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As well as the buffet restaurant there are 2 A'la carte restaurants which you can dine at once each during your stay - Martinos, the Italian, was fabulous - the service was excellent and the food was fabulous - very high quality and made a welcome change from piling up everything on your plate in the buffet restaurant. The wine was also good - whereas in the buffet restaurant it is not. Unfortunately La Taberna, supposedly offering international cuisine, was rubbish - a very limited choice of food - only 4 main courses. I wouldn't bother to eat in there if I was to visit again as the food in the buffet is better.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There are lots of activities going to to keep you busy - although these do vary in quality. The pool based activities such as water aerobics and salsa dancing were popular - the beach ones less so - we watched a terrible animal show - which involved a cocker spaniel called Breezes do some tricks - he wasn't very well trained though and just spent the 'show' running around and ignoring the trainer - however it was hilarious to watch! There is also a hike up into the hills every other day as well as free water sports on the beach - we did sea kayaking, took out pedalos and did some snorkelling (which is superb) - unfortunately the sea was too calm to do wind surfing and hobby cat sailing which is also available.
reviews.title: Loved it, both years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay and were welcomed warmly by the staff. This place gives you the best it has and if you try to compare to the best of Barbados then you can find fault. This is after all Cuba.
reviews.title: Relaxation and the best they have

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean. I am not sure it is worth paying a lot for an upgrade unless you spend a lot of time in your room looking at the sea. Bit obvious but true.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is fine, if a bit samey after 10 days but lunch at the beach is great and breakfast omelettes are super. You will probably come back weighing more than you did when you went.
reviews.title: Ok for a quiet holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: August is rainy in the afternoon but take some good books or just relax in the warmth until the sun sinks over the yard arm.
reviews.title: Loved the Breezes Jibacoa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a very friendly dive school on site. The dive sites are often determined when you get to one by the proximity of local fishermen. If they are fishing you move on somewhere else. The gear is fine and diving is made easy because the dive sites are nearby. The diving is not the Maldives but it is still fun.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings but dull entertainment

aka: Superclubs Breezes Jibacoa Hotel Santa Cruz Del Norte
description: (Will be closed for maintenance from June 8-20, 2008)
